Package ie.gmit.sw.parser

Class SubjectParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • ie.gmit.sw.parser.Parser<java.nio.file.Path>
      • ie.gmit.sw.parser.SubjectParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Void>
    public class SubjectParser
extends Parser<java.nio.file.Path>
    This class is responsible for parsing the subject dataset file.

        public SubjectParser​(java.nio.file.Path filePath,
                     int... k)
        Constructs a new SubjectParser object.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the dataset file
        k - the list of k-mers to parse from the query text

      • SubjectParser

        public SubjectParser​(java.nio.file.Path filePath,
                     java.lang.Character.UnicodeScript queryScript,
                     int... k)
        Constructs a new SubjectParser object.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The path to the dataset file
        queryScript - The Character.UnicodeScript the query belongs to. Languages that don't use this script are ignored
        k - the list of k-mers to parse from the query text
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if k is an empty array

    • Method Detail

      • detect

        public Language detect​(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​LanguageEntry> query)
        Detects a language from a given query.
        Parameters:
        query - A map of k-mers to query against the subject database
        Returns:
        The detected language
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the subject database is empty. This may happen if the dataset file wasn't parsed properly

      • resize

        public void resize()
        Resize the subject database leaving only the most frequently occurring 300 entries.

        Empirical evidence shows that the most frequently occurring ~300 n-grams are highly correlated to a language, with the next 300-400 n-grams more correlated to the subject that a text relates to.

      • resize

        public void resize​(int max)
        Resize the subject database leaving only the most frequently occurring entries. The number of remaining entries is specified by max.
        Parameters:
        max - The maximum number of entries to keep

      • call

        public java.lang.Void call()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
